title: Constructing a Boxplot
question_text: A boxplot is constructed from which of the following numbers?

choices.text: Minimum, first quartile, median, third quartile, maximum.

solution:
A boxplot is directly constructed from the five-number summary consisting of minimum, first quartile, median, third quartile, and maximum.

To find these values, arrange the data in ascending order (from least to greatest).

The minimum is the lowest value while the maximum is the highest value.

The median is the middle value when the values are arranged from least to greatest. If there are two middle values, the median is the average of these values.

The first quartile is the median of the lower half of the data; specifically, it's the middle number between the lowest observation and the median of the data set.

The third quartile is the median of the upper half of the data; specifically, it is the middle number between the median and the highest observation of the data set.

Thus, the correct answer is Choice 'A'.
